images.copyright: Corjuem Fort in Goa, India (© Ingvar Kuznetsov/Shutterstock)
images.title: The forest reclaims a fortress
images.caption: Corjuem Fort in Goa, India
images.desc: Corjuem Fort, built in 1705 by Portuguese colonists, was abandoned in 1894 but never demolished. It is now a protected historical site in Goa, India, and during the right time of year, Corjuem can look like it's being eaten by the forest.

tooltips.walle: This image is not available to download as wallpaper.
tooltips.walls: Download this image. Use of this image is restricted to wallpaper only.
